title: kmc-to-landscape-ranipokhari
news:
KATHMANDU, DEC 21 - 
	The  Kathmandu  Metropolitan City (KMC) has planned to landscape Ranipokhari to add attraction to the recently-renovated landmark. Realising the need to preserve and promote the area, the metropolis planned to outfit the area with various decoration and greenery.

The pond was outfitted recently with musical fountain, which added appeal to the landmark situated in the city centre. Besides this, four other water fountains were also installed at the four corners of Ranipokhari. While the government allocated over Rs 1 million for renovating the landmark before the Saarc Summit, only around Rs 400,000 was used. “Hence, we have requested the government to allow us to use the remaining amount for an extensive landscaping,” KMC chief Dhana Bahadur Shrestha said.

The KMC spent only around Rs 30 million on the musical fountain though the government allocated around Rs 32 million for the same. “We also want to use the remaining amount for the new project,” Shrestha said. He said they plan to open the area for general public after landscaping it. “We will charge certain amount for maintenance,” he said. Besides Ranipokhari, the KMC has also planned to redecorate Khullamanch with grass carpeting and greenery. The “open theatre” too was a part of the Saarc beautification project.
